question: Does the policy avoid using technical phrases or legalese that might mislead users?
What is the business' position on demands from the government for user data?
How does the privacy policy manage any conflicts of interest with regard to the application or exchange of data?
Do users have access to their data and privacy settings?
Are there straightforward methods for users to request data access or deletion?
How does the business handle user approval and revocation of approval?
Does the business reduce storage times?
How is user data aggregated or masked to safeguard personal information?
Are there any limitations on how data may be processed for particular situations or purposes?
Do user communications employ end-to-end encryption?
How are user data from being accessed without authorization prevented?
How are security-related incidents or thefts of information handled and informed to users?
Does the organization carry out privacy impact analyses?
Have any privacy-enhancing technologies, such as differential privacy, been implemented?
How does the use of automated decision-making or profiling by the firm affect the privacy of its customers?
Is the privacy policy updated frequently and made available to users?
Does a procedure exist to handle user privacy complaints?
Does the business release transparency reports describing interactions with law enforcement or government agencies or data requests for surveillance?
Do employees receive training on handling sensitive information and best practices for data privacy?
How are user choices for data privacy maintained across many platforms or devices?
Does the company provide easy to use resources, such as tutorials or guides, to help users successfully manage their privacy settings and comprehend their data rights?
Does this policy conform with all relevant privacy laws and regulations?
What measures are made to guarantee that data processors and subprocessors respect privacy standards?
Is there a procedure in place at the business for reporting and dealing with privacy violations or non-compliance issues, both internally and with third-party vendors? (Hard)
